message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys conducted between 2013 and 2020, we analyze the determinants of firm innovation in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a unique dataset that combines nationally representative household survey data with farm-level panel data from rural Ethiopia to examine the role of crop diversification in enhancing rural welfare.", "dataset": ["nationally representative household survey data", "farm-level panel data from rural Ethiopia"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use publicly available data from the National Household Travel Survey and the General Transit Feed Specification to evaluate the equity implications of public transit subsidies in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Household Travel Survey", "General Transit Feed Specification"], "topic": ["Transport", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite data on climate-vegetation dynamics with high-resolution poverty maps based on household surveys to estimate the impact of droughts on rural poverty in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["satellite data on climate-vegetation dynamics", "high-resolution poverty maps based on household surveys"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Building upon a unique dataset on labor productivity in South Asia, this paper examines the impact of financial sector development on manufacturing firms' productivity growth.", "dataset": ["dataset on labor productivity in South Asia"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on multiple datasets comprising household and enterprise surveys, social network data, and qualitative interviews to assess the transformative potential of women's economic empowerment programs in fragile settings.", "dataset": ["household and enterprise surveys", "social network data", "qualitative interviews"], "topic": ["Gender", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data on registered firms in Norway, this study provides evidence on how Foreign Direct Investment affects productivity through firm-level technology transfers.", "dataset": ["panel data on registered firms in Norway"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of satellite imagery, spatial analysis, and household surveys to examine the causal links between deforestation, land use change, and household welfare in rural Cambodia.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "spatial analysis", "household surveys"], "topic": ["Environment", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This paper exploits a unique dataset on bilateral trade flows and participation in Free Trade Agreements to investigate the spillover effects of such agreements on non-members' trade performance.", "dataset": ["dataset on bilateral trade flows and participation in Free Trade Agreements"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We combine cross-sectional data on household air pollution exposure with detailed information on cooking fuel use and ventilation practices from recent household energy surveys in India to estimate the health impacts of clean cooking policies.", "dataset": ["cross-sectional data on household air pollution exposure", "information on cooking fuel use and ventilation practices from recent household energy surveys in India"], "topic": ["Health", "Climate Change"]}]
